page.title: 05FARMING IN 1885
page.content: In the early days of farming there was no machinery as we have today. When it came to ploughing they did not have our modern day machinery, instead they had 2 to 4 strong horses who would be fastened to the plough and then, with a man walking behind holding on to a tiller, would start off at a reasonable speed and walk up and down making furrows all over the field. After this was done they would be ready for planting. This job would take at least a full day or even longer if it was really hot. The planting would be done by hand and would take at least from dawn one day to dawn the next. Nowadays we have machinery for spreading seeds and a more advanced way of ploughing. With a tractor a field could be ploughed in half a day
